de.systemagmbh.interfaces.table
Interface ISysExtendableTable

All Superinterfaces:
ISysTableModel
All Known Subinterfaces:
ISysTable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DummyISysExtendableTable, DummyISysTable
public interface ISysExtendableTable
extends ISysTableModel

Defines the minimal functionality for a table that allows the manipulation of its columns.

Version:
$Revision: 1.4 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich

Methods inherited from interface de.systemagmbh.interfaces.table.ISysTableModel
getColumnClass, getColumnCount, getColumnName, getRowCount, getValueAt, isEditable, setColumnName, setValueAt
 

Method Detail

hasFixRowCount

public boolean hasFixRowCount()
Return the state of the rows concerning changes.

Returns:
true if the rows can be manipulated. That is rows can be appended and removed. Else returns false.

appendRow

public void appendRow()
Adds a new empty row at the end of the table.

insertRow

public void insertRow(int rowIndex)
Adds a new empty row at the given position.

Parameters:
rowIndex - The index where the row has to be inserted.

deleteRow

public void deleteRow(int rowIndex)
Remove the specified row from the table.

Parameters:
rowIndex - The index of the row to be deleted.

clear

public void clear()
Clear the table. Delete all the rows of the table. The columns are not deleted.
This corresponds to deleteRow(int) for all rows.

hasFixColumnCount

public boolean hasFixColumnCount()
Return the state of the columns concerning changes.

Returns:
true if the columns can be manipulated. That is columns can be appended and removed. Else returns false.

appendColumn

public void appendColumn(String columnName,
                         Object defaultValue)
                  throws CSysTableException
Add a new column with the given name.
Depending on the implementation of this interface the class of this value can be used as column type.

Parameters:
columnName - The name of the new column.
defaultValue - This value is used as default for all new rows.
Throws:
CSysTableException - if the given default value is null.

appendColumn

public void appendColumn(String columnName,
                         Class columnType)
                  throws CSysTableException
Add a new column with the given name. The type of the values is defined by the given class.

Parameters:
columnName - The name of the new column.
columnType - The class that defines the type of the values in the new column.
Throws:
CSysTableException - if the given column type is not supported.

insertColumn

public void insertColumn(String columnName,
                         Object defaultValue,
                         int columnIndex)
                  throws CSysTableException
Add a new column with the given name at the given position.
Depending on the implementation of this interface the class of this value can be used as column type.

Parameters:
columnName - The name of the new column.
defaultValue - This value is used as default for all new rows.
columnIndex - The index where the column has to be inserted.
Throws:
CSysTableException - if the given default value is null.

insertColumn

public void insertColumn(String columnName,
                         Class columnType,
                         int columnIndex)
                  throws CSysTableException
Adds a new column with the given name at the given position. The type of the values is defined by the given class.

Parameters:
columnName - The name of the new column.
columnType - The class that defines the type of the values in the new column.
columnIndex - The index where the column has to be inserted.
Throws:
CSysTableException - if the given column type is not supported.

deleteColumn

public void deleteColumn(int columnIndex)
Remove the column with the specified index from the table.

Parameters:
columnIndex - The index of the column to be deleted.
